item.title: Rachel add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "What you're supposed to do when you don't like a thing is change it. If you can't change it, change the way you think about it. Don't complain." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "If you don't have time to read, you don't have the time (or the tools) to write. Simple as that." -- Stephen King

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Robert Louis Stevenson
item.description: "You think those dogs will not be in heaven! I tell you they will be there long before any of us." -- Robert Louis Stevenson

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The books that the world calls immoral are books that show the world its own shame." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "Don't let the bastards grind you down." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "I am enough of an artist to draw freely upon my imagination. Imagination is more important than knowledge. Knowledge is limited. Imagination encircles the world." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Rachel add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "You speak an infinite deal of nothing." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Rachel add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Lord, what fools these mortals be!" -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Miss Piggy
item.description: "Beauty is in the eye of the beholder and it may be necessary from time to time to give a stupid or misinformed beholder a black eye." -- Miss Piggy

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Henry Ward Beecherr
item.description: "Where is human nature so weak as in the bookstore?" -- Henry Ward Beecherr

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Margaret Mitchell
item.description: "Life's under no obligation to give us what we expect." -- Margaret Mitchell

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "Imperfection is beauty, madness is genius and it's better to be absolutely ridiculous than absolutely boring." -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "A pessimist sees the difficulty in every opportunity; an optimist sees the opportunity in every difficulty." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Rachel add a quote by George Eliot
item.description: "It is never too late to be what you might have been." -- George Eliot

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Andre Gide
item.description: "It is better to be hated for what you are than to be loved for what you are not." -- Andre Gide

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description:
"I can be changed by what happens to me. But I refuse to be reduced by it.
(Popular misquote of "You may not control all the events that happen to you, but you can decide not to be reduced by them.")" -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Rachel add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "If you want to know what a man's like, take a good look at how he treats his inferiors, not his equals." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Both Rowling and Meyer, they’re speaking directly to young people. … The real difference is that Jo Rowling is a terrific writer and Stephenie Meyer can’t write worth a darn. She’s not very good." -- Stephen King

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Darkness cannot drive out darkness: only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate: only love can do that." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Fairy tales are more than true: not because they tell us that dragons exist, but because they tell us that dragons can be beaten." -- Neil Gaiman
